segments.text: The scene is quite a striking contrast, isn't it?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside the window, the garden looks so peaceful and orderly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Inside, chaos is slowly but surely building up in the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is completely serene, washing dishes while a flood happens around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Itâ€™s astonishing how oblivious she remains to the water at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Then there are the children, plotting their cookie raid with such determination.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool beneath the boy looks like it's about to collapse any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me so angry that she's not paying attention to her surroundings!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to step in and fix this before a disaster occurs.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The image of the boy falling off that stool is truly upsetting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe how calmly the water just continues to flow over the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What a mess this is going to be for them to clean up later.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole situation just feels like a ticking time bomb.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find myself shaking my head at the sheer amount of unnoticed hazards.
segments.speaker: PAR
